meanings.definition: Counterreformers: Those who oppose or resist reform efforts.
meanings.sent1: The counterreformers were against changing the rules.
meanings.sent2: The counterreformers stood firm against the proposed changes.
meanings.sent3: The counterreformers at the meeting refused to budge on the issue.
meanings.sent4: In the debate, the counterreformers were like a wall blocking progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of the counterreformers holding their ground was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Counterreformers: Individuals or groups who advocate for a return to traditional or conservative beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The counterreformers wanted to go back to the old ways.
meanings.sent2: Many counterreformers believe in upholding traditional values.
meanings.sent3: The counterreformers' insistence on using outdated methods was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Their group was like a time machine, with the counterreformers leading the way.
meanings.sent5: The counterreformers' dedication to tradition was remarkable.
